extendedMetadata.value: Chapter Quiz: How Sociologists Do Research

extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 5.4: Know the main elements of the 7 research methods: surveys, participant observation, case studies, secondary analysis, analysis of documents, experiments, and unobtrusive measures; state why sociological research can lead to controversy.

config.question: Which of the following qualities is important to keep bias from affecting the data obtained in a survey?

choices.content: Respondents need to be given no less than five answer options.
The survey should contain neutral questions.
The answer options should always include only politically correct choices.
The survey should contain leading questions.

answer_3.response: sider this: Political correctness is not objective. LO 5.4 Know the main elements of the 7 research methods: surveys, participant observation, case studies, secondary analysis, analysis of documents, experiments, and unobtrusive measures; state why sociological research can lead to controversy.

answer_1.response: sider this: The number of answer options will vary in any survey based on the question itself. LO 5.4 Know the main elements of the 7 research methods: surveys, participant observation, case studies, secondary analysis, analysis of documents, experiments, and unobtrusive measures; state why sociological research can lead to controversy.

answer_4.response: sider this: The researcher in no way should try to lead subjects to give certain answers. This would produce bias results.
